para.remark: Thanking everybody for everything is boring and information-free; save the gratitude for the unexpected or impressive stuff. Always avoid commit-counting, and debunk it quickly if someone else starts doing it (story of Steinmetz and the mark here). In general, there is always a tension between making sure that people's individual contributions are recognized, and making the project be a group effort rather than a collection of individual glories (hmmm, that thought ought perhaps go at the start of this chapter).
